Package algorithms.matrix

Class BlockMatrixIsometric

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.matrix.BlockMatrixIsometric
  • public class BlockMatrixIsometric
extends java.lang.Object
    a class to hold a matrix that is partitioned into blocks of the same size.
    Author:
    nichole

    • Constructor Detail

      • BlockMatrixIsometric

        public BlockMatrixIsometric​(double[][] a,
                            int bSize0,
                            int bSize1)
        constructor. The matrix a is not copied in. This is a pass-by-reference constructor.
        Parameters:
        a -
        bSize0 - block size along the first dimension (rows)
        bSize1 - block size along the second dimension (columns)

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        set all values to 0

      • fill

        void fill​(double value)

      • setBlock

        public void setBlock​(double[][] b,
                     int blockNumber0,
                     int blockNumber1)
        set values in internal matrix a for block number (blockNumber0, blockNumber1) to the given block b. b must be the same size as the block size of this instance.
        Parameters:
        b - a given block of values to replace a block of this instance with.
        blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
        blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

      • setRowBlock

        public void setRowBlock​(double[] b,
                        int blockNumber0,
                        int blockNumber1)
        set values in internal matrix a for block number (blockNumber0, blockNumber1) to the given row block b which is a single dimension array. b.length must equal this.bSize1, and this.bSize0 must equal 1.
        Parameters:
        b - a given block of values in a single dimension array to replace a block of this instance with.
        blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
        blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

      • setColumnBlock

        public void setColumnBlock​(double[] b,
                           int blockNumber0,
                           int blockNumber1)
        set values in internal matrix a for block number (blockNumber0, blockNumber1) to the given column block b which is a single dimension array. b.length must equal this.bSize0, and this.bSize1 must equal 1.
        Parameters:
        b - a given block of values in a single dimension array to replace a block of this instance with.
        blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
        blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

      • getBlock

        public double[][] getBlock​(int blockNumber0,
                           int blockNumber1)
        get values in internal matrix a for block number (blockNumber0, blockNumber1)
        Parameters:
        blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
        blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.
        Returns:
        contents of (blockNumber0, blockNumber1) of matrix a in this instance.

      • getBlock

        public void getBlock​(double[][] b,
                     int blockNumber0,
                     int blockNumber1)
        get values in internal matrix a for block number (blockNumber0, blockNumber1) and set them into the given block b.
        Parameters:
        b - the output block for the contents of (blockNumber0, blockNumber1) of matrix a in this instance.
        blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
        blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

      • addToBlock

        public void addToBlock​(double[][] b,
                       int blockNumber0,
                       int blockNumber1)
        add block b to internal matrix, pointwise, for (blockNumber0, blockNumber1). b must be the same size as the block size of this instance.
        Parameters:
        b - a given block of values to add to a block of this instance.
        blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
        blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

      • addToColumnBlock

        public void addToColumnBlock​(double[] b,
                             int blockNumber0,
                             int blockNumber1)
        add column block b to internal matrix, pointwise, for (blockNumber0, blockNumber1). b must be the same size as the block size of this instance, including this.bSize1 must equal 1 at construction.
        Parameters:
        b - a given column block of values to add to a block of this instance.
        blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
        blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

                          int blockNumber0,
                          int blockNumber1)
        add row block b to internal matrix, pointwise, for (blockNumber0, blockNumber1). b must be the same size as the block size of this instance, including this.bSize0 must equal 1 at construction.
        Parameters:
        b - a given row block of values to add to a block of this instance.
        blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
        blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

                              int blockNumber0,
                              int blockNumber1)
        subtract block b from internal matrix, pointwise, for (blockNumber0, blockNumber1). b must be the same size as the block size of this instance.
        Parameters:
        b - a given block of values to replace a block of this instance with.
        blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
        blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

        blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
